page.title: 01Review of block
page.content: GENERAL REVIEW OF WHOLE BLOCK The area is rural with many small villages and lots of farms. The Tillingbourne river runs through the area. It is a short river only eleven miles in length. The A25 bye pass which was built in 1961 also runs through the area. Guildford, the County town of Surrey is six miles to the west, and Dorking a market town is six miles to the east. The area contains much heath and woodland. It is attractive wooded countryside with the North Downs to the north and Hurtwood to the south. Both these areas contain many paths and bridleways. The picturesque villages today tend to be commuter villages. There is only some light industry in the area at Gomshall on the A25. Here there is a tannery and a Target factory which makes archery targets.
